thread.title: Shots Fired, Police Cruiser Rammed During Incident Near U.S. Capitol
thread.title_full: Shots Fired, Police Cruiser Rammed During Incident Near U.S. Capitol

author: Jack Davis
title: Shots Fired, Police Cruiser Rammed During Incident Near U.S. Capitol
text:
Shots Fired, Police Cruiser Rammed During Incident Near U.S. Capitol Struck police cruiser ... Share on Facebook 285 Tweet Email Email Print   
Shots were fired Wednesday morning near the U.S. Capitol in Washington, D.C. after a vehicle rammed into a police car. A suspect has been arrested following a foot chase. Scene in Capitol Hill where a vehicle struck police cruiser and person took off on foot. Before being taken into custody pic.twitter.com/69eJuZF3oE 
— Serena Marshall (@SerenaMarsh) March 29, 2017 
The incident took place at the intersection of Washington Avenue and Independence Avenue, near the U.S. Botanic Garden and the Rayburn House Office Building.   
— Drew Griffin (@GriffDrew4) March 29, 2017 
District of Columbia police indicated that a driver tried to ram a Capitol Police cruiser at about 9:30 a.m., when the first report was made of shots being fired. 
One report suggested that the incident began after a car was stopped at a checkpoint near Capitol Hill.   
D.C. police said that after the Capitol Police cruiser was rammed, the suspect tried to run over several Capitol Police who were on foot. No police were reported injured in the attack. 
Doug Buchanan , D.C. Fire Department spokesman, said the ambulances sent to the scene were not needed to take anyone to the hospital. 
It was unclear if the suspect fired at police, but according to D.C police, Capitol Police fired at the suspect. No one was shot. 
About 15 minutes after the incident began, the suspect was arrested following a foot chase with police.
